fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Not able to remove any recent user added to the site from a group using the DELETE method of the API /rest/api/3/group/user.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Invite any new user to the site
 # Add the user to any existing group
 # Try to delete the user from the group using API
 curl --request DELETE --url ‘https://<site name>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/group/user?groupname=<group name>&accountId=<said>’

h3. Expected Results

User should be removed from the group
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the console
{code:java}
"errorMessages":["An error occurred: com.atlassian.idp.client.exceptions.UserNotFoundException: {\"schemas\":[\"urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error\"],\"status\":\"404\",\"detail\":\"A user with ug:<random-numner> doesn't exists\",\"errorType\":\"UserDoesNotExist\",\"message\":\"A user with ug:4c56a3de-54bf-4e38-9e9b-664738f439d6 doesn't exists\",\"data\":\"ug:4c56a3de-54bf-4e38-9e9b-664738f439d6\"}"],"errors":{}}%  
...
{code}
h3. Workaround

Users could only be removed from the group using the user management page.
fields.summary: Error while removing user from a group using API

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When linking a Confluence page in a Jira issue, that page's link will be displayed under the *Confluence pages* section. But, that's currently not displayed in the issue view in Jira Cloud mobile:
 !Screen Shot 2020-09-22 at 07.53.20.png|thumbnail!  !WhatsApp Image 2020-09-22 at 7.54.20 AM (1).jpeg|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion

Make the *Confluence pages* section available in Jira Cloud mobile's issue view
fields.summary: Display linked Confluence pages in Jira Cloud mobile's issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users are able to populate value to the Text field (read only) from the issue view

As per the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/custom-fields-types-in-classic-projects-972327807.html]:
{quote}A read-only text label. Only possible to create values programmatically (Used internally for imports from Mantis). Maximum of 255 characters.
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Text field (read only) custom field
 # Add the field to project screens - create, edit and view screen.
 # Attempt to populate value into this field from the issue view

h3. Expected Results

The readonly text field should accept values programatically. So the field should not be editable from the issue view.
h3. Actual Results

The readonly text field is editable from the issue view
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Users are able to populate value to the Text field (read only) from the issue view

fields.description:
For radio button or checklist custom fields, it helps a lot to be able to configure them to show the options horizontally instead of vertically. This saves space for fields with more than a few options to choose from.

The configuration can be done in the corresponding field configuration.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When there are different fields with the same name, one for Next-Gen project and other for Classic project, it's not possible to differentiate them into the drop-down selection in Automation:

!image-2020-09-22-12-37-41-359.png|width=373,height=322!
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a Next-Gen custom field in a NG project;

 # Create a custom field with exactly the same name for Classic projects;

 # Create an Automation rule and tries to look for the above fields in one Edit Issue Fields action

h3. Expected Results

When the scope of the rule is restricted to a specific project, it would be nice that the rule itself filter only the applicable fields.

Besides that, for global or multi-project rules, it would be nice to have the id of each field besides its name or even a mention to the project to which this belongs to when it's a NG custom field.
fields.summary: Field lists on Automation rules should only show applicable fields (for project)

fields.description:
The default email handler currently throws error when the incoming message body exceeds 32K characters. There is no issue created.

 

Suggestion: Have message bodies exceeding 32K characters automatically truncated to 32K and let them be created with a little remark. E.g. _[... message truncated]_
fields.summary: Email handler: Truncate emails that exceed 32K characters

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When description is added to a subtask, the same description is showed in the parent issue description

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue (Story, Task, Bug)
# Create a subtask under the parent issue created in Step 1
# Add some text in the *Description* field to the sub-task issue > Save
# Close the sub-task and reopen the parent tasks. The description added in the subtask shows in the parent task
# Close the parent task and reopen again, the original description of the task will be shown as expected

h3. Expected Result
Subtasks description should not show in the parent task description field

h3. Actual Result
The subtask description is shown in the parent issue description

h3. Workaround
Closing and reopening the parent task shows the original description

Note: The behavior is noticed only in the modal view of the issue. If the issues are opened in a new tab the behavior is not noticed.
fields.summary: Jira issue description shows incorrectly on parent issue when a subtask description is updated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Basic search does not display custom field options for Standard issue types. The options are displayed as expected for custom issue types but displays options as expected for custom issue types.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Create a Jira project
 2) Create 2 custom issue types and add it to the new project along with standard issue types.
 4) Create a custom field with multiple options (Checkbox or Select list) and associate a mix of standard and custom issue types to the custom field context. Note that all the custom issue types should not be included that are added to the project.
 5) Create a few issues of standard and custom issue type in the project with a value set for the custom field created in step 4.
 6) Navigate to basic search. Here we should be able to see the options populated for custom issue type but not standard issue type.
h3. Expected Results

Custom field options should be seen for all issue types within the defined custom field context
h3. Actual Results

Custom field options are not displayed for Standard issue type

_+Snippet for custom issue type:+_

!Screenshot 2020-09-22 at 12.49.25 PM.png|width=449,height=150!

+_Snippet for standard issue type:_+

!Screenshot 2020-09-22 at 12.49.04 PM.png|width=470,height=148!
h3. Workaround

Use Advanced search JQL to search for standard type issues along with the required custom field option.
fields.summary: Basic search does not display custom field options for Standard issue types but displays options as expected for custom issue types.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Bulk delete operation fails when trying to delete tasks with subtasks
* The subtasks are within the scope of the search scope

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a Jira project
 2. Create 3 Standard tasks with one sub-task each
 3. Open Advanced issue search and search for all issues in the project
_Filters > Advanced issue search_
 4. Perform bulk delete operation.
h3. Expected Results

All issues under the project are deleted.
h3. Actual Results

Bulk delete operation fails. No error message seen:

!Screenshot 2020-09-21 at 8.38.26 PM.png|width=252,height=269!
h3. Workaround

Delete all sub-tasks first and then delete the remaining issues in the project
fields.summary: Bulk delete operation fails when trying to delete tasks with subtasks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a project workflow contains field related condition/validator, then the available transitions for the issue are not visible when the field value is updated to meet the condition/validator until the webpage is manually refreshed
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Create a Jira project
 2) In the project workflow, add a "Value field" workflow condition:

!Screenshot 2020-09-21 at 7.34.11 PM.png|width=579,height=25!

3) Add the field details as per below example:

!Screenshot 2020-09-21 at 7.33.59 PM.png|width=466,height=182!

4) Save the transition and publish the changes to the workflow
 5) Open an issue and confirm that the issue cannot be transitioned as the condition is not met (In this case, story point field is empty)

!Screenshot 2020-09-21 at 7.45.02 PM.png|width=265,height=382!

6) Populate the story point field. The available status transition for the issue is not visible even though the condition is met

!Screenshot 2020-09-21 at 7.45.23 PM.png|width=278,height=421!
h3. Expected Results

The available transitions should be visible in the Jira issue once the field is updated to meet the workflow condition.
h3. Actual Results

The available status transitions are not visible.
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page once the field value is updated to meet the workflow condition to see the available status transitions for the issue.
fields.summary: If a project workflow contains field related condition/validator, then the available transitions for the issue are not visible even if the condition/validator is met until the page is manually refreshed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using a next-gen project in Jira Cloud, and attempting to setup an automation rule in order to create a new issue based on any trigger, if you attempt to set the Story Point Estimate field on that new issue, it will fail.  The issue is still created, but that value cannot be set by the expected means.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a next-gen project, Create an automation rule with any trigger (manual for example)
 # For the action, select 'create new issue' and choose inside same project (by project key)
 # For this example, I selected to create a new Task type issue
 # Attempt to use the drop down box to select which fields to set, and choose "Story Points"
 # Choose a numeric value for that field to set (example 57)
 # Publish/save run
 # Trigger the automation to run

h3. Expected Results

We expect that a new issue is created and the story point value is 57
h3. Actual Results

Issue is created, but story point estimate value is not set. Automation audit log shows an error like so:
{noformat}
Unknown fields set during create, 
they may be unavailable for the project/type. 
Check your custom field configuration. 
Fields ignored -Story Points (customfield_10044)
Issues created successfully
{noformat}
However customfield_10044 is not the Story Point Estimate custom context field in this Next-gen project, but rather the global custom field used for classic projects.  Instead in this case, I found that in my instance the custom field is actually customfield_10088 in this project
h3. Workaround
 # First in the Choose fields to set, uncheck Story points (this is technically the wrong field)
 # Then at the bottom of the page, scroll down to More options,
 # In more options, manually set the field using json like so:
{code:java}
{
    "fields": {
        "Story Point Estimate": 57
        }
} {code}
 # Save/publish run
fields.summary: Trying to set story point estimate in next-gen project via automation is choosing the wrong field

fields.description: Working on a remote desktop connection & it dramatically impacts performance, those animations aren't necessary and I'd rather have a zippy fast experience over aesthetics.
fields.summary: ability to disable animations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to move a sub-task to a different parent , we get a list of suggestion of Parent issues to move the sub-task to. However , nothing happens if we click the issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select any sub-task from Jira to move the issue.
 # In the confirmation page , start entering the Issue key of the Parent. A list of suggestions are shown. 
# Click the parent issue .

h3. Expected Results
Parent issue should get selected and should be populated in the text field.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens. The issues are not clickable. Refer screen shot.



h3. Workaround
Type the Issue key in the search box and click on "Change Parent" button. Issue gets moved.
fields.summary: Clicking on Parent issue while moving a sub-task to a different parent has no effect

It would be a nice addition to the existing automation features.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Since there's a limit of 65 components by rule in a way to make sure the rules will run stably and won't time out, it would be good if when accessing the rules the amount of components the user might see how many components the rule already has 
h3. Expected Results

It would be nice that, when accessing a rule, the user might be informed of how many components the rule already has, in a way to avoid exceeding the 65 components by rule.
h3. Actual Results

By now, the following error message is shown when the limit was reached:
{code:java}
You've reached the maximum number of 65 components allowed per rule. Please consider splitting this automation rule into multiple rules.  {code}
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: UI message that informs how many components the Automation rule already has

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user makes an update on a ticket and after that, the same is removed from the instance (account deleted), I'm able to @mention the same user and select them from a user picker field. Since the user was deleted, I want that this user does not be shown on the mention list, to avoid conflict internal conflict.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # User X makes an update on an issue.
 # User Y delete the user X.
 # User Y is able to @mention the user X on the same issue or select in a user picker field.

h3. Expected Results

The deleted user should not be shown on the mention list.
h3. Actual Results

The deleted user is being shown on the list.
h3. Workaround

No workaround until the moment.
fields.summary: It should not be possible to mention or select deleted users in user picker field and Jira issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the new issue view, when pressing "L", for editing the label, select a label and click the enter button, the label is not being saved. Instead, the selection is canceled and the value is not saved.

When making the same procedure in the old issue view, the label is being saved correctly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue using the kanban board.
 # Press "L" and select a label.
 # Click enter.

h3. Expected Results

The label is saved correctly.
h3. Actual Results

The label is not being saved, and the selection is canceled.
h3. Workaround

Switch to the old issue view.
fields.summary: Using <enter> key in JIRA issue label just cancels the list instead of saving the selected item in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Documentation related to [Automation service limits|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/what-are-service-limits/] informs that by default only 65 components by rule are allowed. However, it's not detailed what counts toward components to calculate this limit. It would be nice to specify and maybe give some examples
 
h3. Expected Results

It would be nice if the doc contains examples that clarifies what counts towards components for Automation service limits calculation. For example, the following item counts as 6 components since each condition inserted to define the IF/ELSE block is considered as one component:

!image-2020-09-16-11-07-10-298.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The doc only informs that the maximum of 65 components is allowed in each rule.

h3. Workaround

No workaround yet.
fields.summary: Update Automation Service Limits documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Create Branch link is pointing to the previous Bitbucket link
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Create Bitbucket Server on AWS using Atlassian Bitbucket AMI, enable public IP
 2) Create application link [http://ec2-1234.ap-southeast-1.compute.amazonaws.com|http://ec2-13-212-72-206.ap-southeast-1.compute.amazonaws.com/] with Jira Software Cloud using public DNS name for Bitbucket server 
 3) Shutdown Bitbucket Server and start up again. A new public IP address gets assigned and as a result, the public DNS name is changed
 4) Delete and recreate application link  [http://ec2-5678-southeast-1.compute.amazonaws.com|http://ec2-13-229-151-164.ap-southeast-1.compute.amazonaws.com/] with Jira Software Cloud and Bitbucket Server
 5) Try to create a new branch from any issue in Jira Software, the link points back to the original public DNS name [http://ec2-1234.ap-southeast-1.compute.amazonaws.com|http://ec2-13-212-72-206.ap-southeast-1.compute.amazonaws.com/]
h3. Expected Results

Create branch link gets updated 
h3. Actual Results

Create branch link is pointing to the previous link
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Create Branch link is pointing to the previous Bitbucket server link

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The page goes blank and loads again at least twice when you try to open an issue from the search filter (*List view*) due to refresh by Connect Addons
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open "Advanced issue search" page (in menu "Filters > "Advanced issue search")
 # Switch to "List View" via the control on the top right;
 # Filter a list of issues using a JQL
 # Open any issue from the rendered table

h3. Expected Results

The issue view should be opened, fully loaded, and that's nearly it, no visual blinks of the issue view should happen
h3. Actual Results

The issue view opens, loads fully, and (in case of an addon) in a few seconds refresh itself by rendering nothing in place of issue, and in a moment renders issue again.
h3. Notes

This is only happening in "Search Filters" when viewing results in a List view, when you click to view any of the issues.
 The issue does not happen in the Detail view of the search filter or when you browse the issue directly like https://<yourinstnace>.atlassian.net/browse/<issue-key>
h3. Workaround

Load the search result in the *Detail view* 
 Or browse the issue directly https://<yourinstnace>.atlassian.net/browse/<issue-key>
fields.summary: The page goes blank and loads again at least twice when you try to open an issue from the search filter (*List view*) due to refresh by Connect Addons

fields.description:
As a heavy Jira user I would like to pull my emails through to a Jira board so I can track and move emails with actions via a Kanban board. 
 * Granting email access to Jira by sharing outlook credentials. This will be a dynamic connection to AD where Atlassian won't have visibility /access to the business AD or work emails.
 * Emails should appear in the Backlog of a specialist personal email Kanban board. 
 * User should be able to read emails as a Jira ticket.
 * Formatting with images/media and attachment support. 
 * Commenting on a email ticket in Jira will email out to the group / sender but without Jira formatting or styles. Or can be turned off.  
 * User to move emails with 'Actions' to 'ToDo' column and then progress them through the statuses defined in the board.
 * Board is visible to the user and not the group.
 * Status changes should not be emailed out. This board should not be shared however could be if its a shared mailbox. 
 * Assignees are not required as the email recipient is always the assignee. 
 * Other emails which don't have actions can be marked 'Closed' and will drop off the Backlog.
 * Closed emails in Jira will be marked as Archived in AD.
 * Emails which have gone through the Kanban process are Archived when marked Done.  

As this is a new feature there are lots of possibilities so some whiteboarding would have to be done.

This could replace the standard email clients across businesses who use JIRA.
fields.summary: Pull emails into a JIRA Kanban board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Groups in site administration can be marked as "default access groups". E.g.

!image-2020-08-26-11-45-16-462.png|width=583,height=263!

However, if these are updated in site admin they do not get correctly synced back to Jira. This can be seen by looking at the "licenserolesgroup" table in Jira - if a group is marked as a default access group, the "primary_group" column should be set to "Y", however they appear to always get added with "primary_group" = "N".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new group in site admin
 # Navigate to "product access"
 # Choose a product (e.g. Jira Service Desk) and add the group
 # Use the options menu to "Make this group default"

h3. Expected Results

The new group should be synced to Jira in the "licenserolesgroup" with the "primary_group" column equal to "Y".
h3. Actual Results

The new group is synced to Jira and appears in the "licenserolesgroup" table, however the "primary_group" column is always set to "N".

This means that any code in Jira that relies on the state of default access groups will not work correctly. One example is the invite team (agent) dialog in JSD - if the "jira-servicedesk-users" group is removed, then team invite always fails:

!image-2020-08-26-12-05-40-604.png|width=468,height=481!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known in-product workaround for this behaviour. The "primary_group" column can however be manually updated to fix incorrect values.
fields.summary: Updating groups in site admin does not sync default access groups to Jira

fields.description:

h3. Actual Results
The page loads very slow and it keeps refreshing. See the video below:

*  [^bugAnonimous.mp4] 


h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Accessing anonymously the issue navigator keep refreshing all the time

fields.description:
I'd like to raise the suggestion that was suggested in an old ticket (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31309).

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a Connect App, for example [Tempo Timesheets: Time Tracking & Report|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/6572/tempo-timesheets-time-tracking-report?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] creates a select custom field, e.g. Account in case of Tempo, this custom field cannot be cleared in new issue view. If the current value is removed, after reloading the issue the previous value is there again. In old issue view there is no problem, if value of Account custom field is cleared, it stays empty.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Tempo Timesheets
 # Create test accounts in its settings
 # Add Account custom field to the screens of a project
 # Open an issue in new issue view
 # Choose an account in Account custom field and save it
 # Reload the issue in Browser
 # Clear Account custom field
 # Reload the issue in browser

h3. Expected Results
Account custom field should remain empty after clearing its content

h3. Actual Results
If Account custom field is cleared using new issue view, it gets back the previous value.
If Account custom field is cleared using old issue view, it remains empty.

h3. Workaround
Using the old issue view it is possible to clear the content of a select custom field.
fields.summary: Can't unset a select field added by Connect app in the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When number fields are displayed in Jira, and these values exceed 3 digits, there is a convention to use a separator in order to show the difference between thousands, millions, billions, etc. much more easily at a glance.

However end users in Jira Cloud do not have the ability to select which separator they see, at least not directly.  Instead the only way to currently control this is to change your language settings and have your language/region settings adjust this on your behalf.  For English, this is always the comma.  For many users the comma is not an ideal way to separate these values.

Examples:
||Language||appearance||
|English|5,432|
|Russian|5 432|
|Español|5.432|



Numbers consisting of long sequences of digits can be made more readable by separating them into groups, preferably groups of three, separated by a small space. For this reason, [ISO 31-0|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_31-0] specifies that such groups of digits should never be separated by a comma or point, as these are reserved for use as the decimal sign.



h3. Suggested Solution
In the account settings, let users choose how number value separators should be displayed outside of language norms.

h3. Why this is important
End users will sometimes want to see this differently, as it can be much easier to read and understand for different users.  End users should have the ability to choose their own personal setting here.


h3. Workaround 
Changing your Language settings found on https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences to a value such as Russian (Русский) can allow you to view number fields without a comma/period separator.  There also might be other languages that behave in this way.
fields.summary: Allow end users to select their own separator for number fields outside of their language or region

fields.description:
Sub-task should not allow to set issue-level security because Subtaska doesn't have independent security levels.

Subtasks inherit the security level of their parent issue, so we need to block the option to set the security level into a sub-task.
 !image-2020-09-11-14-19-30-886.png|width=530,height=240!

Despite of this set the security level into the sub-task, when I refresh the page this will be removed. 


Besides, this feature request: [Sub-Task should have independent security levels.|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5869] was closed as "Won't Fix". As we will not implement the security level independency to sub-task, we can show a message when anyone tries to set it into a sub-task.
fields.summary: Subtasks inherit the security level of their parent issue, for this we should not be able set issue-level security into a subtask

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Jira Cloud*. Using *Jira Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-71544].
{panel}


h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in order to remove any user from a project within Jira, it has to be done by a project administrator (or higher level such as Jira admin or Jira System admin).  A typical end user without admin rights cannot simply remove themselves from an entire project in Jira.  In some cases they could unassign themselves from individual issues (if permissions allow), but they cannot adequately manage the notifications they receive within a project, remove themselves from assignable users, 


h3. Suggested Solution
It would be ideal if an end user could opt-out of any specific individual project on their own, without the need of an administrator to manage this.  It would be great if there was a single one-time action/script that could be used to unassign any issues from yourself in that project, as well as remove yourself as a project lead, and remove yourself from getting any notifications from a project.


h3. Why this is important
Jira grants total control here to the administrator of a project.  Many times too many users on a site have admin access and can inadvertently add too many or the wrong groups to project roles/adjust notification schemes to include too many users that don't really want to know about a project.  Those end users can't simply opt-out themselves.  Their only solution it to reach out to a Jira Admin in order to get them to adjust the project settings.

In Jira Cloud, we do have a process to honor GDPR regulations such as the right to be forgotten and right to erasure, however this request is not seeking a complete account deletion, but rather the ability to grant more granular control over your own account.


h3. Workaround 
Currently it is not possible for a user that is not a Jira admin/project admin to remove themselves entirely from a project (such as unassigning all issues currently assigned to a single user, and removing a single user from notification schemes, and removing that user as a project lead/component lead/etc).  Please contact a Jira administrator in your site in order to remove your account from a particular project.
fields.summary: As an end user, I want to be able to remove myself from a project

fields.description:
We use Automation for Jira to notify users when an issue with a particular status is raised. There seems to be a hard limit of 50 email recipients for notifications. Looking at the error, it seems to be based on Jira Cloud using the AWS SES email service.

While there are workaround for this, it would be good if this limit was removed/increased. Ideally (for us) to 500+ notifications.
fields.summary: Increase email recipient limit from 50

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is a cascading select list type field that is not working in Basic Search but it working in Advance mode. I have replicated the same in my test instance. I noticed that if I do a basic search for a cascading type filed, the option is not getting selected but if I use advance mode, it is working perfectly fine. I am attaching a screen-recording for your reference.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Global Issue Navigator in Basic Search
 # Click More> select the cascading select type field and choose a select option.
 # In Basic Search, the field option is not getting selected
 # In Advance JQL, the search is working perfectly fine.

h3. Expected Results

We should get the result for Cascading Select List in Basic Search
h3. Actual Results

Not getting the result in the Basic Serch but with Advance JQL, results are proper.
h3. Workaround
 # Please use Advance JQL to search for the Cascading Select List field.
{code} "Custom Cascading[Select List (cascading)]" in cascadeOption("1","1A")ORDER BY lastViewed DESC {code}
fields.summary: Cascading Select-List field type is not working in Basic Search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In classic projects, changing an issue's epic causes jira:issue_updated webhook events to be fired. This does not occur in next -gen projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Change the epic of an issue in a next-gen project.

h3. Expected Results

jira:issue_updated webhook events are fired as a result of steps 2 and 3.
h3. Actual Results

h3. Workaround

None

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Custom fields with an accent like "ó", "ã" or "&" does not appear on the dashboard.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field with the name similar to "órgão".
 # Open a Dashboard.
 # Add a new gadget, for example, Filter results.
 # Add the field "órgão" to "Columns to display".

h3. Expected Results
Fields with an accent like "órgão" or & should appear in the Columns.

h3. Actual Results
 * The field will be not saved and this field with an accent will not appear.
 * I've recorded a video with the current behavior: [Click here to access the video.|https://share.getcloudapp.com/yAubB7Qr]

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is currently possible to perform a JQL search for all issues linked to a particular Confluence page by using the issuesWithRemoteLinksByGlobalId function. The trouble with this is that it requires the GlobalID of the Confluence application link as well as the page ID to which the issues are linked.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow for searching for issues linked to a particular Confluence page using the page's name or potentially other properties. The LinksbyGlobalID function is clunky and requires that you know not only the GlobalID of Confluence but also the specific PageID in question.
fields.summary: Allow Easier Searching of Issues Based on Linked Confluence Page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When pasting URLs from other webapps such as Invision, Jira attempts to create a smart link.

Currently, if you paste a URL from Invision directly in a comment or in the description, you won't be able to open it by left clicking on it.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Copy the URL from your Invision app (e.g. https://<your site>.invisionapp.com/share/<file code>#/screens);
* Paste into a comment.

h3. Expected Results

Left clicking on that link will open the target URL.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens when clicking on the link with the left button.

h3. Workaround

Click with the right button -> open in a new tab. 

Or, use use *Ctrl + Z* or *Cmd + Z* to prevent the link from rendering prior to saving it.
fields.summary: URLs pasted from Invision into comment or description won't open with left click

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the error page from the bulk operations feature suggests the user check application logs which is something not available for customers in Cloud:

 !image-2020-09-07-18-20-14-757.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Change the wording to include a part of the error or a reference to it and a link to the customer can reach out support for further assistance.
fields.summary: Enhance wording for Bulk operations error page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the following query into a Related Issues Condition, Automation is not able to look for existing issues in the instance.
{code:java}
summary ~ {{triggerIssue.summary}} AND issuekey != {{triggerIssue.key}}{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a rule using Issue Created
 # Add a Related Issue Condition with the following query:
{code:java}
summary ~ {{triggerIssue.summary}} AND issuekey != {{triggerIssue.key}}{code}

The rule will inform in the audit log that there was a match with the just created issue, ignoring all the existing issues from the instance.
h3. Expected Results

The rule should be able to look for issues which summary contains the same summary of the trigger issue and which key is different from the trigger issue key.
h3. Actual Results

The condition matches the just created issues even though the query specifies the key needs to be different from the trigger issue:

!image-2020-09-07-12-25-22-806.png|width=821,height=208!

The same problem happens when using Manual trigger and even Issue transitioned trigger.
h3. Workaround

It's possible to use a Branch to look for issues which summary is similar from the just created issue summary:

!image-2020-09-07-12-32-32-583.png|width=770,height=284!
fields.summary: JQL Related Issues Conditions does not work fine for some JQL queries

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Multi select custom fields load all options at once when inserting selecting a value, causing performance issues when there is big number of options.

We had a use case in which there were over 10,000 options to select and this would either make it very slow to load the options or even crash the browser depending on the user's environment set up.

This seems to be related to how Jira Labs (new issue view) handles the field search as when using the old issue view (Jira Labs Off) the search is almost instant.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a multi select custom field
 # Add over a thousand options
 # Create an issue in which the field is visible and editable
 # Try to select an option using the new issue view

h3. Expected Results
Search of options should load fast

h3. Actual Results
Search is slow potentially crashing the browser

h3. Workaround
*Option 1:* disable Jira Labs by accessing your user's personal settings (by clicking in your avatar) and toggling it off.

*Option 2:* 
# Create a new custom field with the *Labels* type to use instead, which has a more optimized search
# Export all the issues with the current custom field value filled in
# Import it back mapping the original column of the custom field to the new custom field of the type labels; this should copy the value of one custom field to another
fields.summary: Performance issues when opening too many options of Multi select custom fields

fields.description:

Unable to create Task under Epic, limited to creating subtasks directly under Epic which eliminates a third level. Also cannot see which Epic a task belongs to on the new issue view.

Reference: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FEEDBACK-179351

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* From the new issue view select 'Create issue in epic' button or  "+" button above the issues.
* The connection error "We couldn't create the child issue" shows from the ticket and couldn't create a subtask.

h3. Expected Results
Subtasks created successfully on the new issue view.

h3. Actual Results
The connection error shows up from the ticket.


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unlicensed Atlassian Accounts (customers for Service Desk) are receiving Jira mention notifications (when they shouldn't) if they are granted browse projects permission by a group. It happens even if the issue does not have a valid request type on it.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a user with no application accesses;
# Create a group and add the user above;
# Go to a Service Desk project and add that group to the browse projects permission;
# Create an issue, with or without request type, and set the user as the reporter;
# Mention that user on an internal or public comment.

h3. Expected results
Since the user does not have any application access, they don't have access to the issue and shouldn't receive Jira notifications.

h3. Actual result
The unlicensed user (customer) will receive mention notifications for internal and public notifications.

h3. Notes
If the unlicensed user clicks in the *View issue* button from the notification, they will be redirected to the portal since they don't have access to Jira.

h3. Workaround
# Remove the group from the browse projects permission;
OR
# Remove the user from the group.
fields.summary: Unlicensed Atlassian Accounts receives mention notifications when granted browse projects permission from the permission scheme

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a user profile is set whereby his full name is his email address, we see the following behaviour as per this scenario:
* when a user/customer creates a service desk ticket (JSD) or an issue (under JSW)
* a related notification will be sent, lets say for "issue created"
* Jira global settings are set as follows under System > General configuration > Email from: "*${fullname} (Jira)*"
* the notification will be coming with a header containing: <useremail@adomain.com> (Jira) <jira@<instance>.atlassian.net>

As the header file is showing as if it is coming from the user's/customer's domain and not from Atlassian, it might get blocked for example by anti spoof policy on customer's mail servers 

h3. Suggested Solution
When a notification is blocked on customer's end, identify and alert the customer of the cause so that the customer can act accordingly.

h3. Why this is important
Agents can miss out on notifications that a ticket has been created which will cause a delay in response time to end customers

h3. Workaround
* regularly export user/customers to identify a full name that contains an email and correct
* change System > General configuration > Email from: "*(Jira)*"
fields.summary: Improved handling when user's display name is his email address

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The admin left side nav panel disappears when navigating to an app admin page twice in succession when project parameters are specified.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

The following steps are based on three webitems at system.top.navigation.bar with definitions as follows.

Webitem (a):
 * context: product
 * url: 
 /plugins/servlet/ac/[APP-KEY]/[ADMIN_MODULE-KEY]

Webitem (b):
 * context: product
 * url: 
 /plugins/servlet/ac/[APP-KEY]/[ADMIN_MODULE-KEY]?project.key=[PROJECT-KEY]&project.id=[PROJECT-ID]

Webitem (c):
 * context: page
 * url: [ADMIN_MODULE-KEY]

 
 # Create a Connect app with three webitems at the location 
 system.top.navigation.bar as detailed above. 
 # Visit any issue in project [PROJECT-KEY].
 # Click on webitem (a) and observe if the left side admin menu is open.
 # Click on webitem (a) and observe if the left side admin menu is open.
 # Visit any issue in project [PROJECT-KEY].
 # Click on webitem (b) and observe if the left side admin menu is open.
 # Click on webitem (b) and observe if the left side admin menu is open.
 # Visit any issue in project [PROJECT-KEY].
 # Click on webitem (c) and observe if the left side admin menu is open.
 # Click on webitem (c) and observe if the left side admin menu is open.

h3. Expected Results

The left side admin menu is open at steps 3, 4, 6, 7, 9, 10.
h3. Actual Results

The left side admin menu is open at steps 3, 4, 6, 9, but not steps 7 and 10.

It appears that passing the project context causes the left side admin menu to disappear on subsequent visits.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Admin side nav panel disappears in some circumstances

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using issue navigator's basic search on a custom field with a colon character in the name returns the wrong results.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field with a colon character (i.e. {{:}}) in the name e.g. "My example field:"
 # Modify an issue to have a known value for this field e.g. 42
 # Navigate to the issue navigator (click "Filters", then "Advanced issue search")
 # Use the basic search to add a filter of your custom field = known value e.g. "My example field:"=42

!Screenshot_2020-09-04 Issue navigator - Jira.png|thumbnail!
h3. !Screenshot_2020-09-04 Issue navigator - Jira(1).png|thumbnail!
h3. !Screenshot_2020-09-04 Issue navigator - Jira(2).png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
 * The issue list only has issues with the given custom field value
 * The refinement bar shows that your custom field is set to the value you specified

!Screenshot_2020-09-04 Issue navigator - Jira(4).png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
 * The issue list shows all issues, regardless of the custom field value
 * The refinement bar shows that your custom field is set to "All"

!Screenshot_2020-09-04 Issue navigator - Jira(3).png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
 # Remove the colon character (i.e. {{:}}) from your custom field name
 # Click "Switch to JQL" and build your search using JQL
fields.summary: Using issue navigator's basic search on a custom field with a colon character in the name returns the wrong results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Activity Stream gadget not working on a single user filter
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Select any Dashboard
# Edit Dashboard
# Add gadget
# select "Activity Stream" gadget
# Edit the gadget and filter by "username" and select the user you wish to filter by

h3. Expected Results
Activity Stream to show the related user activity

h3. Actual Results
Message showing: "No activity was found"

h3. Workaround

# Have them copy the value for "content" and send it to you.
fields.summary: Activity Stream gadget not working on a single user filter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira needs to perform migrations when you, for example, add a new workflow to a workflow scheme and the impacted issues will have their statuses changed.

Currently, if there is a big number of projects associated with that workflow scheme, you will end up in an error page with an error message stating that the *Request header is too large*:
 !Screen Shot 2020-09-01 at 14.40.40.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Have a big number of projects associated with a workflow scheme;
** During my tests, I've created a CSV file to create over *360 projects*:  [^Jira.csv] 
* Have all those projects be associated to the very same workflow scheme;
* Add a new workflow to the workflow scheme;
** In my tests, the workflow I added would result in the change of status in the issues.
* Publish the workflow scheme.

h3. Expected Results

The migration process will occur without any errors.

h3. Actual Results

The process will end in an error page. 

In my tests (as well as the customer's case), the procedure was completed despite that error page. 

It seems like the error occurs only when trying to get back to the list (the URL still contains all the ids of the projects at this point, which could explain the reason why the header of the request is too large).

In my tests, I had over 300 issues that had their statuses changed. I did not see any inconsistency on them so far.


h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Request header too large error when publishing changes in a workflow scheme associated with a big number of projects

fields.description: Currently, we do not have any logging within the site itself to get the information about the email that are not delivered and bounced back to Atlassian. Logging such information or providing at least that there is a bounce in a form of error within the site would be helpful to for site admins to understand and get back to us.
fields.summary: To have a log within the cloud site, to give information on emails that get bounced

fields.description:
The explanation of Public is "anyone on the internet, including logged in and *anonymous users*", but the people who can create next-gen project are only licensed users (*not anonymous users*). This is a misleading explanation.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When the global permission for "Create next-gen projects" is "public", the explanation of "public" will be misleading

fields.description: I'd like to view Issue Navigator in backlog order (which is already possible), but with the ability to re-order the backlog from there using drag and drop.
fields.summary: Ability to re-order the backlog from Issue Navigator using Drag and Drop.

fields.description:
The issue color field is not available for change when making a bulk change. In the bulk edit screen, the issue color field is set with a default purple option and I cannot choose a different color for it.

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Go to search issues, find issues.
 # Click in bulk edit.
 # Select the Edit option.
 # Find the issue color field.

*Expected results:* 

I can choose a different color for that field.

*Actual results:*

I cannot choose a different value for that field.
fields.summary: Issue color field be available for bulk change

fields.description:
*Problem:*

Currently, if Product Access is given to a Group synced from External Directory, the users in the group are not added to the Default Access Groups automatically.
Due to which Admins have to duplicate their efforts in giving permissions to the Groups.

*Solution:*
Need a way to automate the group assignment Process based on User's domain via UI or API (script)
fields.summary: Allow External Directory users to be added to Default Access groups automatically

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in "Issue Statistics" gadget, when selecting a cascading field , the percentage will calculate based on parent - child value. There are no options to get percentage by parent value.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to choose for Cascading field (by parent value)

h3. Why this is important
User will be able to get the report or percentage based on parent value.
fields.summary: Ability to get a report for cascade field option based on parent value

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Custom user picker field is unable to suggest users in basic search

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a basic searc
 # Add a user picker field
 # Search for a user. 

h3. Expected Results

The field should give suggestions on users that can be used for the search

h3. Actual Results

The field is unable to give suggestions. 

 !error.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

Switch to advance search and perform the user search there. The custom field can give suggestions. 

 !workaround.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Custom user picker field is unable to suggest users in basic search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The independent scrolling feature is being rolled out to the new issue view. 

Now, the view is divided in two panels: the description area in the left column, and the fields/custom fields in the right columns:

Currently, you do not have the ability to resize the columns as you wish. That might be inconvenient for users that have their main focus on an specific column when working.

h3. Suggestion

Provide the ability to resize the columns as the users wish.
fields.summary: Ability to resize columns in the new issue view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37117].
{panel}
 
h3. Issue Summary
Grant "Browse Project" permission to "User custom field value (XXXX)" makes the project is visible to all users. Regardless of whether that field is filled or not.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Go to the permission scheme > grant "Browse Project" permission to "User custom field value (XXXX)" 

h3. Expected Results
Project should not visible to all users here: https://<sitename>.atlassian.net/projects

h3. Actual Results
Project is visible to all users here: https://<sitename>.atlassian.net/projects

h3. Workaround
Remove the  "User custom field value (XXXX)" in the Borwse project permission
fields.summary: Grant "Browse Project" permission to "User Custom Field Value" makes project visible to all users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The icons for webitems displayed at jira.navigator.pluggable.items can easily be chopped off or missing completely. Also, the name of the web item at this location is not displayed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an app that declares four web items at jira.navigator.pluggable.items with the following icons; (A) 32x32 PNG, (B) 16x16 PNG, (c) 16x16 SVG, (d) 32x32 SVG.
 # Navigate to the issue search view and observe the web items.

h3. Expected Results

The icons for all web items are displayed in full and a tooltip is provided displaying the name of the web item.
h3. Actual Results

None of the web items have tooltips and only the icon for web item (b) is displayed in full. The upper left quadrant of icon (A) is displayed and the icons for web items (C) and (D) are not displayed.
h3. Workaround

Only web items with 16x16 PNG icons work at this location.
fields.summary: Web items at jira.navigator.pluggable.items are not well supported

fields.description:
Jira has separate fields for Epics and other issue types, which end up being redundant and confusing for users. Here are the main examples of this:
* Issue color and Epic Color.
* Parent Link and Epic Link.
* Summary and Epic Name.
* Status and Epic Status.

It would be interesting if only regular fields were used. This would make Jira less complex for users.
fields.summary: Epic fields like Name/Colour/Link/Status can be confusing for users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When using the Mac app for Jira Cloud, you cannot currently configure any board settings, such as card layout.  However this is still something that can be configured in the web interface


h3. Suggested Solution
Provide board configuration options within the Mac app.


h3. Why this is important
Users want to be able to perform the same configuration options in the mac app that you can in the web interface

h3. Workaround 
(Optional)
fields.summary: Jira Mac App should be able to configure board settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Jira Cloud*. Using *Jira Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-71491].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Jira in the default settings is only storing two digit precision for years. This is not always a problem, but in some cases this can lead to data issues.

For parsing with the abbreviated year pattern ("y" or "yy"), SimpleDateFormat must interpret the abbreviated year relative to some century. It does this by adjusting dates to be within 80 years before and 20 years after the time the SimpleDateFormat instance is created. For example, using a pattern of "MM/dd/yy" and a SimpleDateFormat instance created on Jan 1, 1997, the string "01/11/12" would be interpreted as Jan 11, 2012 while the string "05/04/64" would be interpreted as May 4, 1964.

[http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/text/SimpleDateFormat.html]

Today Jira still ships with a default date format of only two digits for the precision of the year, such as MM/dd/yy.
h3. Suggested Solution

We should really not be relying upon Java's interpretation of what year is intended. Instead we should be implementing a four digit value for the year by default. This would require us to change the defaults for In the System > General Configuration > Advanced settings:
 # *jira.date.picker.java.format*
 # *jira.date.picker.javascript.format*
 # *jira.date.time.picker.java.format*
 # *jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format***

 But also in the Look and Feel settings for Date/Time Format:
 # *Complete Date/Time Format*
 # *Day/Month/Year Format***

*+For the java values+* 
 * Change all the 'yy' values to 'yyyy'

 *+For all javascript values+* 
 * Change the '%y' values to '%Y'

h3. Why this is important

Many users can create items and dates of events well beyond a 100 year range.  This becomes a real and obvious problem when trying to store that date with only 2 digits.  Dates entered such as 1/1/41 can be very ambiguous as to which year is being referenced here.  Relying upon Java, today that is interpreted as 1941, but next year, that would be interpreted as 2041 (20 years from the current year).  The solution seems obvious to attempt to completely avoid the ambiguity here and instead store this data with 4 digits of precision.  This solution it won't impact existing users and can prevent customer frustration and bad data over this problem.
h3. Workaround

Jira administrators can change these java values from yy to yyyy and javascript values from %y to %Y to make this change manually.
fields.summary: Jira should store all dates that contain years with 4 digits of precision, and not just 2 digits

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating Issues on a Next-Gen project using the *+ Create Issue* button or the *Incoming Mail* feature the configured *Restrictions* are not respected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set a Role *Restriction* on a certain Issue Type of a Next-Gen project
 !image-2020-08-28-12-43-48-586.png|width=518,height=218!
 # Create a new Issue using the + Create Issue button:
 !image-2020-08-28-12-46-54-678.png|width=250,height=100!

h3. Expected Results

The *Restriction* should be set to the newly created Issues
h3. Actual Results

The *Restriction* is not set to the newly created Issues
h3. Workaround

Create Issues using the *Create* button from the top bar
fields.summary: Quick/Email Created Issues on Next-Gen projects are not respecting configured Restrictions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Once a workflow scheme is edited and published, a migration is triggered that moves all the linked projects to the new workflow.

This process currently fails for any archived/trashed projects, leaving them still linked to the original (unmodified) scheme.

The active projects will instead be moved to a intermediate copied scheme (with the changes applied).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two to three different projects. Make sure that they have different issue types.
 # Associate the same workflow scheme to all the projects.
 # Edit the workflow scheme by adding/removing a workflow.
 # Move a project to the trash (or archive it).
 # Publish the workflow scheme draft.

h3. Results
 - A copy of the workflow scheme will be created
 - The original scheme will remain active

!image-2020-08-28-12-51-52-478.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

No workaround other than deleting/restoring the project in the trash can.
fields.summary: A Workflow scheme associated with trashed/archived projects remains active after the migration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Upload of Excel files (CSV, XLSX) with over 7MB get stuck at the very end when using the new issue view.

Note: we only tested with small files (less than 1MB) that this did not occur and with files over 7MB. We can't tell yet if this occurs for files between 1MB and -7MB.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any issue detail in the new issue view
 # Upload a XLSX file that is over 7MB
 # Wait as usual to finish
 # You'll notice that it gets stuck at the very end like the example below.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
# File should upload as usual

h3. Actual Results
# Upload is stuck

h3. Workaround
Disable Jira Labs by clicking in your user avatar, heading to personal settings and disabling it through the toggle button
fields.summary: Upload of Excel files (CSV, XLSX) with over 7MB get stuck at the very end when using the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The bug was raised by vendor that in case when changing project in Connect in SPA, when app try to do transition the sidebar is hidden. After doing reload everything is working fine again.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to App section > Select the Application

 2. Change the Project, within the App, and then the sidebar will get hidden.

h3. Expected Results

The Sidebar should not get hidden in changing the project with the application.

h3. Actual Results
The Sidebar is getting hidden upon changing the project.

h3. Workaround

On refreshing the browser, the sidebar again starts appearing.
fields.summary: While changing project in Connect in SPA, when the app tries to do transition, the sidebar is hidden.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Epic dropdown field in Create Issue modal is not keyboard accessible
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use a keyboard
 # Try to pick an epic

h3. Expected Results

it is accessible
h3. Actual Results

its not

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

use a mouse
fields.summary: Epic dropdown field in Create Issue modal is not keyboard accessible

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When cloning an issue, if the _Resolution_ field is already set, its value is copied into the new issue that was just created. This happens both for Classic and Next-Gen project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # When accessing any issue, clicks on "..." and then on Clone
 # The status of the just created issue will be set as the very first of the workflow, but its Resolution will be copied from the clone issue

h3. Expected Results

The Resolution value should be cleared
h3. Actual Results

The Resolution value is copied from the clone issue. This problem happens both in Next-Gen project AND Classic projects.

[https://share.getcloudapp.com/Qwu0nPD9]
h3. Workaround

+Both Next-Gen and Classic projects+

Access the board and transition the issue to another status that is not Done/Resolved/Closed. Then, move the issue back to the very first status of the applied workflow:

[https://share.getcloudapp.com/6quezd5z]

+For Classic projects+

It's possible to add a post-function in the Create transition (*right before the _Create the Issues Originally_ post-function*) in order to clear the Resolution field, as shown below:

!image-2020-08-31-12-20-38-148.png|width=650,height=254!
fields.summary: When issue is cloned, existing resolution date is copied over

fields.description:
Why not allow us to add action items in Jira ticket description? It’s fascinating to me that we can easily do it in Confluence but not in tickets.

It’s a lot of overhead to create a confluence page for this, while it would be super easy to creat a task inline with a mention @. Exactly like in... Confluence. But right in the ticket. Sub-tasks don’t address this need.

Actually there is a BIG need for adding a list of things that need to be done in a Jira ticket, to make the ticket ready to go in a sprint for instance. Example:

⬜️ John to validate copy with client

⬜️ Sarah to provide a design

⬜️ Andrew to get the requirements

 

A User Story is a place where people collaborate. Creating task within the ticket description would be such a simple, easy way to collaborate.
fields.summary: Allow for action item creation from ticket description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the 'Enter' key after selecting an option from any dropdown filed, the system gives an error message
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select any dropdown field
 # Start typing the letters which will help you find the correct option you need from it
 # When you find it, select the option with the arrow and hit Enter

h3. Expected Results
When you hit 'Enter' the field should finish populating the selected option
h3. Actual Results

You will get an error message with the letters of your search saying:
"FIELD with key 'Test' does not exist."

This is due to the system interpreters that you finish the issue creation
h3. Workaround

Once you find the correct option you would like to use on that field, go down with the arrow and hit *TAB* from your keyboard
fields.summary: When using the 'Enter' key after selecting an option from any dropdown filed, the system gives an error message
